page.title: 05LIFE-STYLES
page.content: Mrs.Jones' maiden name was Bellamy,and the Bellamys have lived in Rushock since 1616.There have only been twelve months since then,when no Bellamys have lived there.When any Bellamy died,he was buried next to the rest of the family in the local church.The Bellamys,like the rest of the local large families,helped run a farm together.But Mrs.Jones married and moved to Portsmouth for sixteen years.She returned to live in an old chimney-sweep's house.This chimney- sweep was like the "odd-job" man of the parish,and was essential to many elderly people there. Before the war,every household would own a pig and a few chickens,and all gardens were planted with vegetables,not flowers.All households had to be self-sufficient.There was and still is only one "shop/post
